block.p: Sandra Katherine Mancini and Peter Michael Yu were married yesterday at the Episcopal Chapel of the Transfiguration in Grand Teton National Park in Wyoming. The Rev. Lynn Wright, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Carl Beavers, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Ms. Mancini, 35, is keeping her name. She is the vice president for work force development at the New York City Partnership, an organization that supports economic development in the city. She graduated and received a law degree from the Catholic University of America.

Sandra Katherine Mancini and Peter Michael Yu were married yesterday at the Episcopal Chapel of the Transfiguration in Grand Teton National Park in Wyoming. The Rev. Lynn Wright, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Carl Beavers, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Ms. Mancini, 35, is keeping her name. She is the vice president for work force development at the New York City Partnership, an organization that supports economic development in the city. She graduated and received a law degree from the Catholic University of America.
The bride is a daughter of Lucy and Guido Mancini of Scotch Plains, N.J. Her father is an owner of Mancini Builders, a residential construction company in Scotch Plains.

Mr. Yu, 38, is the president and chief executive of the capital partners division of the American International Group, the New York insurance and financial services company. He graduated from Princeton University and received a law degree from Harvard.

The bridegroom is the son of Dr. Marie S. Yu and Dr. Charles C. Yu of Windemere, Fla. His parents retired from Potomac Hospital in Woodbridge, Va., where his mother was an anesthesiologist and his father was the chairman of the anesthesiology department. The bridegroom's father was also an adjunct assistant professor of anesthesiology at George Washington University in Washington.
Ms. Mancini and Mr. Yu met in 1993, when both worked in the White House for the National Economic Council.
